title: European Stocks Rise, U.S. Markets Closed
description: European Stocks Rise, U.S. Markets Closed
content:
In the U.S. markets were closed.

In Europe, the Stoxx Europe 600 gained 0.3% in morning trading. Konecranes rose 5.1% and Bridgepoint Group added 4.5%. On the other hand, Amadeus IT Group sunk 1.5%, and Tate & Lyle slipped 1.5%. The FTSE 100 added 0.3%. Other stocks in Europe were up as France's CAC 40 increased 0.3% and Germany's DAX climbed 0.4%.

In commodities, Brent crude rose 0.4% to $67.77 a barrel, and WTI crude rose 0.5% to $64.31 a barrel. The European benchmark price for natural gas, the Dutch futures contract TTF, was up 1.9% to 32.23 euros a megawatt hour.

The German 10-year Bund yield rose by 3 basis points to 2.757% from 2.727%, and the yield on the 10-year U.S. Treasury climbed by 2 basis points to 4.233% from 4.233%. Bond prices and yields move in opposite directions.

Stocks in Asia were mixed as Japan's Nikkei 225 index fell 1.2%, whereas Hong Kong's Hang Seng climbed 2.1%. China's benchmark Shanghai Composite climbed 0.5%.

-This article was automatically generated by MarketWatch.
summary: The Stoxx Europe 600 gained 0.3% in morning trading, with other European stocks also gaining. However, Amadeus IT Group and Tate & Lyle were all in decline. In other news, Brent crude rose 0.4% to $67.77 a barrel and WTI crude rose to $64.31 a barrel. The German 10-year Bundish also rose by 3 basis points to 2.9% and the U.S. Treasury by 2 basis points.
shortSummary: European stock markets rose, with key markets like Europe's leading shares rising, while U.S. markets closed, amid mixed reactions in Asia.
argos_summary: European markets opened higher, with the Stoxx 600, FTSE 100, CAC 40, and DAX all gaining around 0.3‑0.4%. Key European stocks Konecranes and Bridgepoint rose over 5%, while Amadeus IT and Tate & Lyle fell 1.5%. Commodities saw modest gains: Brent at $67.77, WTI at $64.31, and TTF gas up 1.9% to €32.23/MWh. Bond yields edged up, with the German 10‑year Bund at 2.757% and the U.S. 10‑year Treasury at 4.233%. Asian markets were mixed, with Japan’s Nikkei down 1.2% and Hong Kong’s Hang Seng up 2.1%, while China’s Shanghai Composite rose 0.5%.
